page.title: 08TRADE IN MAWNAN
page.content: Many of Mawnan's{shopkeepers}have moved here from different parts of the country because they thought it had a lot to offer. Only one person was born here. To make a good living the shops have to sell a wide range of goods to attract a variety of customers. The number of shops has grown from 3 ( a grocers, Post Office and a butchers to 12 shops now. The building of the square promoted growth in Mawnan which is a small thriving shopping centre attracting holiday makers and people who can't get into Falmouth. Most of the older people we interviewed shopped locally but the younger ones chose Falmouth. The prices in Mawnan are more expensive, but you get a good, friendly service. There are two {banks}which are open at various times of the week. An unusual new shop has just opened, it sells handmade lace.
